channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Budget 2021: Chancellor set to announce £400m for arts sector
item.description: The funds will aim to help museums, theatres and galleries in England reopen once restrictions ease.

item.title: Tourism hotspots hit hard by Covid-19 jobs crisis
item.description: Experts say the pandemic has exposed "underlying inequalities in the labour market".

item.title: UK cruise ships scrapped in India's 'ship graveyard'
item.description: Months after being sold to buyers from outside the UK they were sold on as scrap.

item.title: 'Fake accounts used my pictures to sell sex'
item.description: Women tell BBC Scotland how scammers used their images on fake accounts advertising sex work websites.

item.title: Taylor Swift criticises Netflix show for 'deeply sexist joke'
item.description: The pop star accuses the Ginny and Georgia series of "degrading" women in an angry tweet.

item.title: University to pay out £5k for 'less valuable' experience
item.description: Details of student complaints about Covid's impact are released - including one award of £5,000.

item.title: Covid-19 variants pose 'real threat' to vaccine progress, CDC warns
item.description: A top health expert says highly contagious variants of the virus pose a "real threat" to the US.

item.title: Covid: France approves AstraZeneca vaccine for over-65s
item.description: Older French patients can now get the jab, which had been initially limited to those aged under 65.

item.title: Covid vaccines cut risk of serious illness by 80% in over-80s
item.description: The UK will soon be in a "very different world", government scientists promise after the success of the jabs.

item.title: Trainer banned in Britain after dead horse picture
item.description: Leading Irish trainer Gordon Elliott is temporarily banned from racing in Britain after being pictured sitting on a dead horse.

item.title: Prince Philip transferred to second hospital for heart condition tests
item.description: The Duke of Edinburgh, 99, will undergo testing and observation for a pre-existing heart condition.

item.title: Swinney agrees to publish Salmond case legal advice
item.description: The deputy first minister was facing a vote of no confidence over the government's advice from Alex Salmond's civil case.

item.title: The new voice of The Simpsons character Dr Julius Hibbert
item.description: Kevin Richardson is the first black actor to voice Dr Julius Hibbert on the television comedy.

item.title: The Papers: Digital travel passes and 'prayers for Philip'
item.description: Plans for a vaccine passport to boost travel and fears over Prince Philip's health are among the front-page stories.

item.title: Documenting emperor penguins in Antarctica
item.description: Stefan Christmann spent almost 15 months in Antarctica alongside 10,000 emperor penguins.

item.title: Palestinian 'Techno Queen' Sama' Abdulhadi faces court over shrine event
item.description: DJ Sama' Abdulhadi is facing a court hearing following a music event near a West Bank holy site.

item.title: Back to school with a little bear and his hearing aids
item.description: How a picture book about a little bear who discovers he is deaf tells a personal story for its creators.

item.title: Possible 'Banksy' artwork appears on Reading prison wall
item.description: The street art appears overnight on the side of Reading Prison which is under threat of development.

item.title: Love Island: South Africa's reality show is 'too white'
item.description: Viewers are asking why most contestants in the reality show are white in the majority-black country.

item.title: 'Undiscovered Titian painting' found in Ledbury church
item.description: An art historian claims to have found the Renaissance master's signature during restoration work.

item.title: Becca Cosmetics: Why lockdown is bad news for make-up brands
item.description: The Australian company is the first big make-up brand to close its doors due to the global pandemic.

item.title: Fortnite: From piano player to pro gamer - aged just eight
item.description: Joseph Deen tells the BBC about his ambitions after signing with a professional esports team.

item.title: How rape allegations have rocked Australian politics
item.description: A political adviser's accusation has prompted other women to come forward with their own allegations.

item.title: Dozens of arts freelancers lose out on Covid support over tax 'error'
item.description: Dozens of arts freelancers miss out on Covid support because of errors with their pay, Equity says.

item.title: Syria war: 'This is the price we had to pay for freedom'
item.description: Syrian civilians describe the devastating impact 10 years of war has had on them.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Study shows one-in-three children have rarely been leaving the house
item.description: Only a third of children in Bradford had sufficient exercise during the first lockdown, a study shows.

item.title: Richarlison boosts Everton's top-four hopes and extends Saints' miserable run
item.description: Richarlison continues his good form as Everton keep their European ambitions on track with victory over out-of-form Southampton.

item.title: 'I feel like I’m playing for my career just now' - Murray digs deep to win in Rotterdam
item.description: Britain's Andy Murray earns his first tour-level win since August with a gutsy fightback against Dutch wildcard Robin Haase in Rotterdam.

item.title: Premier League referees: Time to mic up officials, says Chris Sutton
item.description: The current Premier League referees are the "best around" but it is time to mic them up, says former striker Chris Sutton.

item.title: Shrewsbury boss Cotterill readmitted to hospital
item.description: Coronavirus-hit Shrewsbury Town manager Steve Cotterill is readmitted to hospital - a fortnight after being released.

item.title: Whose side could 'implode' without him? Garth Crooks' team of the week
item.description: Who played the most glorious pass you will ever see? Whose performance had been a long time coming? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

item.title: Police make arrests after search of Barcelona offices
item.description: Catalan police make four arrests after searching the offices of La Liga side Barcelona.

item.title: Arsenal's Katie McCabe scores stunner into top corner to seal Aston Villa win
item.description: Katie McCabe scores a stunner in the top corner as Arsenal convincingly beat Aston Villa 4-0 in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Covid: Can I go on furlough and will it be extended?
item.description: The chancellor is being urged to extend the furlough scheme until summer at the earliest

item.title: When does the stamp duty holiday in England and Northern Ireland end?
item.description: Stamp duty changes introduced to boost the housing market are due to end in March.

item.title: What are the Brazil, South Africa and UK variants and will vaccines work?
item.description: More cases are being found in the UK, including a variant first seen in Brazil.

item.title: Covid: Which areas are being mass tested for new variants?
item.description: The government hopes "surge" testing will reduce transmission of new variants of Covid-19.

item.title: Lockdown Learning: What educational resources are on TV, iPlayer and online?
item.description: As schools remain closed to most pupils, the BBC is offering a wealth of educational material.

item.title: Budget 2021: Five things to look out for
item.description: Tax rises and an extension of Covid support are both tipped to be announced in this week’s Budget.

item.title: Budget 2021: What is it and when will it happen?
item.description: The Budget - when is it, what does it do and what should we expect to hear from the chancellor?

item.title: Budget 2021: 'Furlough is a lifeline, I hope they extend it'
item.description: More support for jobs is expected in Chancellor Rishi Sunak's Budget, but will it be enough?

item.title: Coronavirus: How much will it cost the UK and how will we pay?
item.description: The pandemic is costing the government hundreds of billions of pounds. Where will it all come from?
